data.app_name: Star Wars: Tales from the Galaxy's Edge
data.description:
Star Wars: Tales from the Galaxy's Edge is an action-adventure experience where you’ll take on the role of a droid repair technician operating near the Outer Rim. When a group of pirates attack you on Batuu, you’ll discover that anyone in the galaxy can become a hero.

Fight alongside classic characters like R2-D2 and C-3PO, and take on unexpected alliances and deadly enemies. Visit Seezelslak in his cantina to pick up missions that will take you into the wilds of Batuu — or become part of his legendary tales.

Continue your story in Last Call*, the new add-on adventure in the Outer Rim. Enjoy new tales, eras and places in this epic conclusion.  

The experience takes place on the outskirts of Black Spire Outpost on the planet of Batuu, as depicted in Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge, the immersive epic lands at Disneyland Resort in California and Walt Disney World Resort in Florida.

*Must own the base game, Star Wars: Tales from the Galaxy's Edge, to purchase Last Call add-on content.

changelog.change_log: Fixed a graphical issue where shaders weren't loading properly on some Quest 1 devices.
Fix to automatically install the DLC if the player's save games require it, and it isn't installed already.

1.1.7
Fixes
Ensured Fast Travel would be available after receiving The Lost Ruins mission 
Resolved rare issue where Enemy of the Baron mission being active at the wrong time would prevent Fast Travel
Resolves situation where Ayuu disappears if the player quit the game in a certain interval
Fixes misalignment in Splintered Spire E-Web turret in certain circumstances

1.1.6
Fixes What’s Up Dok not triggering in certain scenarios
Fixes additional streaming problems in Bounty of Boggs Triff in receptionist area
Corrects Secrets in the Cantina not loading after the player had previously finished the Rescue R2-D2 mission, in certain cases
Fixes Audio Corruption in Bounty of Boggs Triff on Quest 2
Prevents blocking Problem with loading Sardeevem Chasm if player quit just after destroying fuel tanks
Cosmetic fix in Mubo’s Workshop
Audio fixes in The Sacred Garden and Cavern of the Moons

1.1.5
Additions/Major Changes:
Support for Hand Oriented Steering: With Hand/Controller oriented steering enabled, your forward direction is determined by which way your controller is pointing. Point your controller in a direction, then press forward on the movement controller (Left by Default, Right if the Southpaw setting is enabled). To change your forward direction, physically point the controller in the way you want to go, while pressing the thumbstick forward.
Audio updates/ mix pass


Fixes:
Stability fixes, reductions in memory usage to improve stability.
Reduced false-positive internet connectivity warnings during DLC download
Resolved blocking issue in First Order Facility where cinematic would not start if player moved too fast from start of level.
Resolved blocking issue in First Order Facility when reloading during interaction with Drill console 
Resolved blocking issue in Lost Jedi Ruins at bridge where player would respawn with Lens and cinematic would not play.
Resolved blocking issue blocking fast travel in Cantina if player quit during Temple Of Darkness intro cinematic
Resolved blocking issue with early broom grab in Cantina
Resolved blocking issue where What’s Up Dok would not trigger in certain cases
Resolved bad save point in Cavern of the Moons after the artifact scan leading to unloaded geo when loaded
Updated Cavern of the Moons moon puzzle to resolve blocking issue, telegraph activation more clearly
Resolved blocking issue in Bounty of Boggs Triff where structural weakness remained untargetable
Resolved issue unlocking Baubles with Bina if Temple Of Darkness already complete 
Resolved blocking issue in First Order Facility if player died next to LB-1033 hallway
Resolved issue in The Sacred Garden where player could force push stones onto the roof blocking progression
Ensured that Deek’s Medallions challenge can be completed if started on revisit
Ensured Melee Madness and Weapons section would be visible in Challenges if DLC not installed
Ensure Mubo Merchandise challenge could be completed if player removed Advanced Hoverpack
Fixed repeating Dok line in Sardeevem Chasm
Decals and Various cosmetic fixes
Rewards consistency pass

1.1.2
Fixes:
Unlocked Fast Travel in the scenario where the user quit after obtaining the Temple of Darkness mission during the cinematic.
Ensured that Dok-Ondar will give the first mission in the scenario where the user grabbed the broom immediately upon entering the Cantina during Secrets in the Cantina mission delivery.

If you have experienced download problems or the three-dot infinite load screen when installing/booting Last Call:
The fix is in v33 of the Oculus OS, which should be available to all users now. Please ensure you do both of the below steps in this order:
1. Go to the Oculus Settings menu -> About and look for a System Update. If you are on Version 32 or earlier, a new update should be available, and you should install that update.
2. Ensure you have enough free space for the download (we are recommending 12G if possible) then download the latest version of Tales.

1.1.1
Fixes:
Prevented future instances of freemove settings being defaulted improperly on initial startup after upgrade (head steering will now default to ON for users with no previous preference)
Removed the broom from the Cantina until after the user has received both Secrets from the Cantina mission, and Dok’s Deal mission to prevent future instances of Dok missions not initiating. 
Prevented an instance of Fast Travel being incorrectly disabled if the user quits during Seezelslak’s Songs mission intro (either after Seezelslak’s Snacks, or Dok-Ondar’s Deal opening) and re-enabled Fast Travel in those instances.

1.1
Additions/Major Changes:
- Support for Last Call DLC.
- Additional purchasables in Mubo’s Workshop, including Hoverpack Mobility Module, Blade and Elite droids, glove buffs.
- Hybrid Head Based Steering mode added to Settings menu.
- Crouch button support.
- Hoverpack Drift and Blink to Hover comfort settings added. 
- Pause Menu update.

Fixes:
- Various stability fixes

1.0.4
Fixes:
Fixed Quest 2 crash upon quitting from Main Menu 
Fixed crash in certain situations when player is caught in geo and unable to be pushed out

Additions/Major changes:
Added “smooth turning” toggle, and options to adjust smooth turning speed, found in Movement Settings in the Pause Menu.
Added the ability to switch between head-oriented, and hand-oriented movement, through the Settings menu under movement when Free Move is toggled on.
Removed ability to directly stow the All-Kit in the pouch by dropping it in.  All-Kit can still be placed directly into an inventory slot if stowing is desired. 
Added additional range to torso settings as well as pouch settings to support more body types in non-Belt Only mode.
Added further additional forward range for belt positioning adjustment when in Belt Only mode to support reclined seating postures.
Added “palm pointing grab” as well as “finger pointing grab” to allow more angles that successfully grab items.
Properly support two handed force usage in Temple of Darkness.
Added LT/RT labeling to UI expand button to make clear that the triggers can expand/collapse the menu.
Usability tweaks to reduce accidental item grabs from inventory.

Fixed hands becoming invisible during level transition/respawn.
Aim improvements/weapon tuning.
Compass fixes.
Audio mix adjustments for J-4X, C-3PO holocalls, other items.
Looping adjustments for music.
Prevented a case in Mubo’s Cargo Transport where player could restore behind a closed door.
Prevented a case in Hissiq Springs where certain configurations of enemy spawns could prevent player progression.
Fixed a rare case of losing the All-Kit tool when pausing during return to belt.
Improved compass behavior across multiple missions.
Prevented combat from starting during loading screen.
Fixed issue where current item state would not be properly saved in certain scenarios.
Fixed issues around lightsaber penetrating ground in smooth loc mode.
Fixed an issue where enemies would rarely briefly show a visual glitch on death.

Fixed several instances of visual holes in geometry in various locations.

Fixed Seeker droid shots continuing after seeker droid destruction in certain cases.
Fixed E-Web audio cutting out in certain situations.

Fixed missing credits reward when completing “Darkness In Us All.”
Fixed rare issue with Seezelslak animation popping after completing Temple of Darkness.
Fixed rare issue with pirate bodies flying midair post-death.
Fixed player teleport distance reduction when teleporting with left hand during scan.
Fixed missing Viper droid combat chatter.
Restored VFX for remote droid destruction in Mubo’s Workshop.
Prevented overlapping VO when throwing multiple remotes during Mubo’s remote intro.
Fixed issue which allowed credits to be duplicated in certain situations.
Fixed cinematic issues caused by restoring Threepio’s eye at unexpected times.
Fixed incorrect opening color coding in dial puzzle.
Fixed a rare bug where weapons and held items could become invisible if vented during menu open.
Prevent low health beep from playing during final Splintered Spire cutscene.
Ensured ammo meter is visible on shotgun while holstered.

Fixed a rare case where the All-Kit tool could be lost by dropping it just after unscrewing a bolt.
Failsafe to ensure player will always have an All-Kit tool once it’s initially found.
Failsafe to ensure a player with no weapons and an empty holster will always have a pistol after level transition or load.

1.0.1 
Fixed a rare issue where player could load outside the playable space in Mubo’s Workshop when moving during level transition.
Fixed audio glitches during combat in Hissiq Springs fighting viper droids.
Fixed an issue where Bacta sprays could be dropped midair.
Fixed an issue where changing the active mission when the compass was in inactive mode resulted in compass not functioning properly.

Fixed misplaced cover points in various maps.
Fixed various issues with Cargo Vessel animation in Mubo’s Cargo Transport
Fixed prioritization of Cantina Problem with Porgs mission in certain scenarios.
Fixed J-4X video cutting out if player paused at very start of game.
Fixed an instance of “Pieces of the Pilot” mission arrow pointing incorrectly in Splintered Spire.
Fixed heavy blaster ammo indicator not appearing when holstered.

What’s new in 1.0.3?
 
New Movement Options
A new Smooth Turning toggle can be found in the Settings menu under the Movement option. When set to ON, this setting allows players using either Free Move or Teleport to turn smoothly rather than snap turning. There is also a new setting for Smooth Turning Speed so that players can customize the speed of smooth turning faster or slower for comfort.
A new option called Head Oriented Steering has been added to Free Move settings. This toggle is on by default, and means that the player can steer themselves by turning their head while moving forward. When this toggle is turned off, the player can only steer themselves with the controller thumbstick.

Additional Body Position/Body Type Support and Improved Grab
The player torso and the player inventory pouch now both can be adjusted farther from the player’s body for additional comfort.
When the Belt Only toggle is turned ON, the player torso can be adjusted even farther, in both the forward/back and the up/down ranges.  This should allow players in seated positions to move the holsters and All-Kit, so that they can be reached more comfortably. This is meant to support a wider range of reclined seating postures, as well as player heights and body types. (These settings are independent of the Player Height setting in Common Settings, which can be used to adjust the player height in the world.)
We have also adjusted the remote grab targeting so that players can target either by pointing their finger, or their palm, at an item they wish to pick up. This should improve the ability for the player to pick up items on the floor without bending over.

Changed All-Kit Tool Stowing Method
If the All-Kit tool is dropped in midair or over the inventory pouch, it will automatically snap to its holster.  Auto-stowing in the inventory pouch has been prevented.
If you wish to put the All-Kit Tool into your inventory, you still can!  Just open the inventory by pulling the pouch off your chest, and stow the All-Kit directly into an inventory slot of your choice.

Inventory LT/RT to Expand/Collapse
Text has been added to clarify that LT or RT can be used to expand/collapse the inventory when open.
Adjustments have been made to reduce accidental pickup of items when attempting to expand or collapse the inventory.
